https://newspunch.com/robert-de-niro-trump-possibly-crazy-medical-sense//Robert De Niro: Trump Is Possibly ‘Crazy’ In A ‘Medical Sense’/"President Donald Trump is possibly “crazy” in the medical sense
column2: according to Robert De Niro
column3: who provided as evidence a bizarre anecdote about the president standing in front of a helicopter and sweating without asking for a handkerchief.

column1: “When I saw him out in front of the helicopter waiting to go somewhere and talking endlessly and sweating and sweating and not even —I said
column2: this guy is not even aware of what he’s—he should at least ask somebody for a handkerchief or something and dry himself off.

column1: “There is something very strange about that
column2: ” De Niro said on CNN Sunday morning.

column1: WATCH:
CNN “Reliable Sources” host Brian Stelter then asked De Niro if he thought President Trump is an actor playing a role or “performing.”
De Niro nodded slowly before saying that “in some ways I think he is… but in some ways these other pundits on Fox are too
column2: because I can’t believe they would actually buy into this craziness.”

column1: “This guy should not be president
column2: period.”

column1: Host Brian Stelter said
column2: “When you say that
column3: folks on Fox come after you. I remember the Tony’s when he got up there and cursed.”

column1: De Niro shot back
column2: “Fuck ’em. Fuck ’em.”

column1: Stelter said in response
column2: “This is cable
column3: so it’s not an FCC violation
column4: but it’s still a Sunday morning. I do wonder why you choose to go that way.”

column1: De Niro said
column2: “In this country where this guy is like a gangster. He’s come along
column3: and he’s said things
column4: done things we say over and over again. This is terrible. We’re in a terrible situation. We’re in a terrible situation
column5: and this guy just keeps going on and on without being stopped.”"/['Baxter Dmitry']/2019-09-30 19:15:54+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/robert-de-niro-1200x630-cropped.jpg.optimal.jpg"

https://newspunch.com/new-pipeline-protests-after-trump-revives-keystone-dakota-projects//New Pipeline Protests After Trump Revives Keystone
column2: Dakota Projects/"Hundreds of protesters opposed to the Keystone XL and Dakota Access pipelines took to the streets of Washington on Tuesday night after President Trump signed executive orders clearing the way for the controversial projects to move forward.

column1: Trump’s order to revive the controversial Keystone XL and Dakota Access pipelines has triggered outrage among environmentalists and native American activists.
Press TV reports:
The protesters were mostly from Native American tribes who have formed a movement against the projects.
“There’s a man sitting in that house right now who is not going to stand for anyone other than himself
column2: ” Eryn Wise
column3: a member of the Jicarilla Apache Nation
column4: told the gathering outside the White House.

column1: “We’re not going away. Welcome to your fourth day!” chanted the others.
The protests signaled the return of a series of protests against the Dakota Access Pipeline
column2: that began in the state of North Dakota last year and spread all across the country.

column1: Led by the Standing Rock Sioux
column2: more than 100 Native American tribes have warned that the four-state pipeline would destroy their sacred sites and contaminate their water resources.

column1: The 1
column2: 100-mile (1
column3: 770-km) pipeline would be the first to transport crude oil from Bakken shale
column4: a vast oil formation in North Dakota
column5: to refineries in the US Gulf Coast.

column1: The Keystone pipeline
column2: which would bring Canadian crude from Alberta into the US Gulf
column3: was rejected by former President Barack Obama in 2015
column4: following seven years of protest by environmentalists.

column1: During his presidential campaign
column2: Trump said Obama reluctance to give the go-ahead to the projects was indicative of the Democratic Party’s anti-business attitudes.

column1: After signing the orders before a crop of reporters in the Oval Office
column2: Trump said the projects would put Americans back to work.

column1: House Speaker Paul Ryan also hailed the move
column2: saying the projects would “strengthen our nation’s energy supply and help keep energy costs low for American families.”

column1: The protests
column2: which saw heavy crackdown by police
column3: ended last year after DAPL was brought to a halt on Obama’s order."/['Niamh Harris']/2017-01-25 19:22:48+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/pipeline-protest-1200x630-cropped.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: https://newspunch.com/payday-loan-brokers-help-themselves-to-uk-savers-accounts-customers-outraged//Payday loan brokers help themselves to UK savers’ accounts
column2: customers outraged/"Brokers linked to payday loan companies may be raiding the bank accounts of over 1 million Britons
column3: with many being the poorest in society
column4: the UK’s biggest banks have warned.

column1: Natwest
column2: one of the largest retail banking chains in Britain
column3: said it was “inundated” with complaints from customers.

column1: Victims claimed that brokerages
column2: offering deals on payday loans – short term loans with very high fixed rates of interest – are extracting sums of £50 to £70 from savings accounts without informing customers first.

column1: According to Natwest customers
column2: the businesses are websites that offer to find payday loan deals online. However
column3: buried in the small print is a tacit agreement that brokers can access the bank accounts at any time.

column1: Natwest
column2: who told the Guardian that they had received up to 640 complaints a month regarding payday brokerage websites
column3: said the majority of customers affected were financially vulnerable
column4: and in many cases were already severely overdrawn.

column1: The brokerage websites have also been accused of sharing financial information with other businesses without consent
column2: and charging an additional levy for its services on top of the huge rates of interest slapped onto standard payday loans
column3: which can be more than 3
column4: 000 percent.

column1: “We’ve seen large numbers of customers incurring charges they don’t expect when using a payday loan broker since July this year
column2: ” said Terry Lawson
column3: head of fraud and chargeback operations at the Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS) group
column4: which includes Natwest and Ulster Bank.

column1: “Customers’ account or debit card details are gathered and sent on to up to 200 other brokers and lenders who charge them fees for a loan application
column2: ” he added.

column1: The news comes as thousands of customers who took loans with controversial payday loan company Wonga are to have their debts written off
column2: in an action expected to cost the legal loan shark more than £200mn.

column1: The UK’s financial watchdog
column2: the Financial Conduct Authority
column3: said Wonga did not do enough to vet customers and their ability to pay back the interest incurred on loans
column4: which can be higher than 5
column5: 000 percent.

column1: As a result
column2: a large number of Wonga customers were forced to admit they were unable to pay the company back after taking out a short-term loan.

https://newspunch.com/payday-loan-brokers-help-themselves-to-uk-savers-accounts-customers-outraged/#respond/Payday loan brokers help themselves to UK savers’ accounts
column2: customers outraged/"Brokers linked to payday loan companies may be raiding the bank accounts of over 1 million Britons
column3: with many being the poorest in society
column4: the UK’s biggest banks have warned.

column1: Natwest
column2: one of the largest retail banking chains in Britain
column3: said it was “inundated” with complaints from customers.

column1: Victims claimed that brokerages
column2: offering deals on payday loans – short term loans with very high fixed rates of interest – are extracting sums of £50 to £70 from savings accounts without informing customers first.

column1: According to Natwest customers
column2: the businesses are websites that offer to find payday loan deals online. However
column3: buried in the small print is a tacit agreement that brokers can access the bank accounts at any time.

column1: Natwest
column2: who told the Guardian that they had received up to 640 complaints a month regarding payday brokerage websites
column3: said the majority of customers affected were financially vulnerable
column4: and in many cases were already severely overdrawn.

column1: The brokerage websites have also been accused of sharing financial information with other businesses without consent
column2: and charging an additional levy for its services on top of the huge rates of interest slapped onto standard payday loans
column3: which can be more than 3
column4: 000 percent.

column1: “We’ve seen large numbers of customers incurring charges they don’t expect when using a payday loan broker since July this year
column2: ” said Terry Lawson
column3: head of fraud and chargeback operations at the Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS) group
column4: which includes Natwest and Ulster Bank.

column1: “Customers’ account or debit card details are gathered and sent on to up to 200 other brokers and lenders who charge them fees for a loan application
column2: ” he added.

column1: The news comes as thousands of customers who took loans with controversial payday loan company Wonga are to have their debts written off
column2: in an action expected to cost the legal loan shark more than £200mn.

column1: The UK’s financial watchdog
column2: the Financial Conduct Authority
column3: said Wonga did not do enough to vet customers and their ability to pay back the interest incurred on loans
column4: which can be higher than 5
column5: 000 percent.

column1: As a result
column2: a large number of Wonga customers were forced to admit they were unable to pay the company back after taking out a short-term loan.

column1: https://newspunch.com/financial-analyst-us-economy-on-brink-of-inevitable-collapse//Financial Analyst: US Economy On Brink of “Inevitable” Collapse/"Todd Wood
column2: a financial analyst and author of the book “Currency”
column3: believes the US economy is on the verge of collapse. Wood’s interpretation of the current world financial situation leads him to the conclusion that Russia is gearing up to become the next great financial world power. Russia’s economy collapsed in December
column4: as we reported in late 2014.

column1: Sputnik News reports:
The fact that Russia bought another 30 tons of gold earlier this week
column2: bringing its total gold reserves to 1
column3: 238 metric tons should make the United States worried
column4: said Todd Wood
column5: the author of the book “Currency” and a contributing writer at the Washington Times.

column1: Wood claims that the current state of the US economy is troublesome
column2: to say the least. While both Russia and China keep increasing their gold reserves
column3: the United States has gathered an overwhelming sovereign debt due to foolish spending habits that will inevitably bring the US economy down
column4: the author said.

column1: Russia is now the fifth-largest holder of gold reserves
column2: according to the IMF. Moscow is increasing its gold reserves to strengthen the value of its own currency
column3: the ruble. The smart move
column4: Wood argues
column5: adding that Russia is “preparing for the day when the tables will turn” and the world will see the decline of the Western economic power.

column1: Unlike the United States
column2: that has foreign debt approaching to $20 trillion
column3: Russia’s debt stood at $600 billion
column4: as of January 1
column5: 2015. This is 33 times less than that of the United States. Furthermore
column6: US foreign debt keeps getting bigger and bigger; meanwhile
column7: Russia managed to cut down its debt by 17 percent since last year.

column1: Washington should be worried about this. Soon the US might wake up and find itself in a world
column2: where it will be bankrupt
column3: meanwhile Russia
column4: which has a gold-backed currency
column5: will then dictate the new rules of an economic realm.

column1: “There will be serious
column2: deadly consequences to our irresponsibility
column3: which emanated from both party’s lack of financial discipline
column4: ” Wood said. “At some point the Federal Reserve will lose control of the bond market. Our fiat currency will only be worth the paper it is printed on. The top-heavy
column5: Western
column6: socialist
column7: welfare-state societies will collapse under their own weight.”

column1: The United States is broke. The only thing keeping the US economy afloat right now is the US Federal Reserve that intervened to keep interest rates artificially low
column2: Wood said.

https://newspunch.com/u-s-to-legalize-marijuana-nationwide//U.S. To Legalize Marijuana Nationwide/"The U.S. government are set to reclassify marijuana as a “Schedule Two” drug later this year
column2: essentially making cannabis legal in all 50 states.

column1: The U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration say that the reclassification will take place nationwide on August 1
column3: meaning that members of the public across America will all have access to medicinal marijuana before the end of the year.

column1: Smobserved.com reports:
The DEA Lawyer had told the lawyer representing a DEA informant of the DEA’s plan to legalize medicinal cannibis nationwide on August 1
column2: 2016. When questioned by our reporter
column3: the DEA lawyer felt compelled to admit the truth to him as well.

column1: “Whatever the law may be in California
column2: Arizona or Utah or any other State
column3: because of Federal preemption this will have the effect of making THC products legal with a prescription
column4: in all 50 states
column5: ” the DEA attorney told the Observer. Federal Preemption is a legal doctrine that where the US Government regulates a particular field
column6: State and local laws are overridden and of no effect.

column1: He explained that “there are five DEA schedules. Nothing on Schedule One is ever legal
column2: and that is where Cannabis is today. Schedule Two drugs are available with a prescription.”

column1: On Schedule Two
column2: marijuana will join drugs like Percocet
column3: Aderall
column4: Oxycontin
column5: Hydrocodone and other drugs that are legal
column6: even common
column7: with a prescription. There are also other drugs that are not on any schedules but that are illegal on a federal level
column8: he said. Drugs like aspirin and ibuprofen are available over-the-counter.

column1: He opined that the 135 medicinal cannabis clinic owners in Los Angeles will no doubt oppose this move by the Federal government
column2: because the rule change will eliminate any reason for people to visit medical marijuana clinics. “In my opinion
column3: CVS pharmacy
column4: Rite-Aid and Walgreens will sell Schedule Two THC products similar to what users call “edibles
column5: ” but will not sell smokable weed because of the health risk smoking anything entails
column6: ” said the DEA lawyer.

column1: The Los Angeles based DEA Attorney who spoke to us
column2: asked to remain anonymous because he was not authorized to speak to the press about the matter. He speculated that this action will be taken in the closing days of the 2016 U.S. Presidential election
column3: so as to motivate the Democratic base to turn out and vote for Hillary Clinton
column4: and other down ballot candidates. She will certainly not reverse this policy decision taken in the waning days of the Barack Obama administration
column5: he said. But Donald Trump might.

column1: “Marijuana enforcement is a big drain on DEA resources
column2: ” he said was another reason for the change
column3: noting that a majority of the American public favor the legalization of marijuana for medical use.

column1: Libertarian candidate Gary Johnson is in favor of legalizing marijuana and in fact owns a business which peddles pot in New Mexico.
California will vote on November 7th
column3: whether to legalize the recreational use of marijuana. Because of Federal preemption
column4: the DEA’s reclassification of cannabis as a Schedule Two drug
column5: will have the legal effect of requiring a prescription in California–i.e.
column6: it will continue the status quo.

column1: Since the Golden State legalized medical marijuana almost 20 years ago
column2: Federal authorities have occasionally raided medical marijuana clinics here. They have forced major banks
column3: like Bank of America
column4: to close clinic bank accounts. The Feds have even seized real estate belonging to landlords who rent space to pot clinics. The Federal war on medicinal marijuana will abruptly end on August 1
column5: 2016."/['Sean Adl-Tabatabai']/2016-06-20 05:38:32+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/US-legalise-weed.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: https://newspunch.com/the-secret-connection-between-the-plague-california-drought//The Secret Connection Between The Plague And California’s Drought/"We recently reported that the CDC are warning doctors in the U.S. to be on the lookout for cases of the plague.
So far
column2: 11 victims in the United States have contracted the disease
column3: leaving 3 dead.

column1: New reports now suggest a connection between this outbreak of plague and the horrific California drought.
Breitbart.com explains: “It is unclear why the number of cases in 2015 is higher than usual
column2: ” the CDC reported.

column1: Dr. Bruno Chomel
column2: a professor at the University of California
column3: Davis School of Veterinary Medicine
column4: told Fox News that California’s record drought may be playing a role in the increase in plague cases. Plague is often transmitted to humans through the bites of infected fleas
column5: and rodents carrying those fleas may be scavenging for food near campgrounds as food options become scarce due to drought
column6: Chomel told the outlet.

column1: Infectious disease specialist Dr. Amesh Adalja told Fox that Chomel’s rodent theory appears to check out.
“These cases are occurring in locations where we know that plague exists in the [rodent] population
column2: ” Adalja said.

column1: When left untreated
column2: the mortality rate for plague cases ranges between 66 to 93 percent
column3: according to the CDC. However
column4: antibiotics available today have reduced the mortality rate of the plague to approximately 16 percent.

column1: The CDC urges people engaging in outdoor activities in areas where the plague is known to occur to wear long pants
column2: use insect repellent and avoid contact with sick or dead animals.

column1: FOXnews.com further explains the plague-drought connection theory: A number of factors — including the behavior of people or rodents
column2: or even the California drought — could play a role in the cases of this bacterial infection.

column1: While there haven’t been any studies looking to see if the California drought is affecting plague risk
column2: past research has shown that weather can affect plague transmission
column3: said Dr. Bruno Chomel
column4: a professor at the University of California at Davis
column5: School of Veterinary Medicine.

column1: Chomel speculated that if the drought is limiting food options for rodents
column2: the animals may be seeking food in camp grounds.

column1: In addition
column2: warmer temperatures are favorable for flea activity
column3: and if there is an increase in the flea population
column4: the insects may be looking for more hosts
column5: Chomel said."/['Royce Christyn']/2015-08-27 03:47:24+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/08/Screen-Shot-2015-08-26-at-11.45.49-PM.png"

column1: https://newspunch.com/malaysia-no-conclusive-evidence-russia-behind-mh17-downing//Malaysia: No ‘Conclusive Evidence’ Russia Behind MH17 Downing/"The international investigative team have failed to present conclusive evidence Russia was responsible for the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17
column2: according to a Malaysian minister

column1: Transport Minister Anthony Loke told Channel NewsAsia: “There is no conclusive evidence to point at Russia under the JIT (Joint Investigative Team) evidence”
Moscow has also rejected the JIT’s accusation
column2: saying it was an attempt to “discredit Russia in the eyes of the international community”.

column1: RT reports: Last week
column2: the Dutch-led probe claimed that the missile that hit flight MH17 in 2014 and led to the jet crashing
column3: came from a BUK missile system that belonged to a Russian military unit stationed in western Russia. The interim JIM probe results repeated almost one-year-old allegations made by activist group Bellingcat. Despite Moscow insisting that no Russian missile system ever crossed into the Ukraine
column4: Netherlands and Australia were quick to declare Russia “responsible” for the deployment of a BUK missile system.

column1: While the blame-game continues to build up momentum
column2: several Dutch parties
column3: including the Party for Freedom (PVV)
column4: Dutch Socialist Party
column5: Forum for Democracy
column6: and the Christian Democratic Appeal (CDA)
column7: raised questions as to why Ukraine was not held responsible for what occurred over its territory.

column1: On Thursday
column2: Dutch Foreign Minister Stef Blok said that he could not “rule out anything” speaking about Kiev’s potential liability for the crash
column3: but noted there was no “hard legal ground” for it.

column1: Russian authorities have repeatedly highlighted the fact that Ukraine failed to close airspace
column2: while the West continues to pin the blame on Moscow.

column1: Moreover
column2: Moscow has provided the investigators with untampered radar data
column3: which “didn’t establish any aerial objects approaching the passenger Boeing from the western side
column4: ” according to Russian military.

column1: The latest round of allegations also conveniently came “in light of the upcoming important international events
column2: ” Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov noted in an apparent reference to the 2018 FIFA World Cup that starts in Russia in just two weeks."/['Niamh Harris']/2018-06-01 20:57:09+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/MH17-1200x630-cropped.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column7: raised questions as to why Ukraine was not held responsible for what occurred over its territory.

column1: On Thursday
column2: Dutch Foreign Minister Stef Blok said that he could not “rule out anything” speaking about Kiev’s potential liability for the crash
column3: but noted there was no “hard legal ground” for it.

column1: Russian authorities have repeatedly highlighted the fact that Ukraine failed to close airspace
column2: while the West continues to pin the blame on Moscow.

column1: Moreover
column2: Moscow has provided the investigators with untampered radar data
column3: which “didn’t establish any aerial objects approaching the passenger Boeing from the western side
column4: ” according to Russian military.

column1: The latest round of allegations also conveniently came “in light of the upcoming important international events
column2: ” Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov noted in an apparent reference to the 2018 FIFA World Cup that starts in Russia in just two weeks."/['Niamh Harris']/2018-06-01 20:57:09+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/MH17-1200x630-cropped.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: https://newspunch.com/7-popular-devices-that-spy-on-you-without-your-permission//7 Popular Devices That Spy On You Without Your Permission/"Did you know the seven electronic devices listed below are as much a security threat to you as a hacker who can read your emails and access your phone?
The Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC) wrote a letter to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) asking them to look at technology from the likes of Microsoft
column2: Google
column3: Amazon and others
column4: citing the “always on” technology as being “worrisome”.

column1: Yahoo Finance report:

EPIC fears the average consumer isn’t aware that some of these devices are actually spying on them by recording their conversations even when the device seems to be turned off. The privacy implications of these devices
column2: which they believe infringe on individual rights
column3: is profound.

column1: The companies say the devices are only engaged in “conversation” when triggered by a “hotword” or a certain gesture. However
column2: those designs can’t be counted on to always work as planned and could cause accidental recordings.

column1: If you’re worried about your privacy
column2: here’s a list from EPIC that can help you audit your chances of staying anonymous.

column1: Google Chrome
The browser is reportedly able to remotely install code that allows the software to listen to users without their knowledge. The code was originally designed to support Chrome’s new “OK
column2: Google” hotword detection
column3: which activates a computer response when you talk to it. However
column4: some users claim the code was installed and activated on their computers without them giving their permission.

column1: Google responded to these complaints on its Chromium developer boards. “While we do download the hotword module on startup
column2: we do not activate it unless you opt in to hotwording
column3: ” the company wrote. Some developers question this claim.

column1: Samsung SmartTV

The Samsung SmartTV has a built-in microphone that is equipped with voice recognition technology that allows users to give verbal commands to the TV. In order for Samsung to convert your speech to text
column2: the voice commands are sent over the Internet to a third-party for interpretation.

column1: However
column2: since the TV is “always on
column3: ” the microphone is recording every word you’re saying at all times. Even in its SmartTV privacy policy
column4: Samsung acknowledges that all spoken words
column5: including personal or other sensitive information
column6: are sent unencrypted to the third party.

column1: Nest Cam
This Internet-streaming home security camera is a product of Nest Labs
column2: which is now owned by Google. The camera comes with a microphone and streams video and sound directly to a consumer’s smart phone in real time. With the Nest “Aware” app
column3: Google can record and save up to 30 days of video and audio.

column1: Using the recording
column2: the camera has the ability to alert users when an “unusual sound” is detected. Nest has the capability of distinguishing between unknown or known voices
column3: which is an important security feature. But privacy advocates are fearful because the company does not disclose how the technology works or how much information the company collects.

column1: Canary Connect

Canary Connect is another company that develops Internet-connected home security systems. The security device can store audio and video recordings from inside a user’s home for 90 days and can be set to one of three modes — “armed
column2: ” “disarmed” and “privacy.” Unless the device is in “privacy” mode
column3: it will automatically begin to record when triggered by motion.

column1: Users have complained that there isn’t an easy way to determine what mode the device is in. In addition
column2: the interface doesn’t notify consumers when it is switching modes.

column1: Microsoft’s Kinect
Microsoft has installed its “always on” voice and motion recorder
column2: called Kinect
column3: in its Xbox videogame consoles. When users say the word “Xbox
column4: ” the Kinect tracks and records the users’ voice and hand gestures in order to follow commands. In order for the device to know when to turn on
column5: the console monitors conversations at all times.

column1: Amazon Echo
Amazon Echo
column2: like other voice-activated computer programs
column3: is triggered awake by the word “Alexa.” The device is constantly listening in on household conversations for the word
column4: which then triggers the system to record and stream the recording to Amazon’s cloud for processing and storage. Amazon has not revealed what data the system collects and if it saves conversations or words said before “Alexa.” In addition
column5: various companies are in the process of incorporating Alexa into their Internet-connected devices. Amazon has not revealed how much information it will have access to once these other companies begin to collect their own data.

column1: Mattel’s “Hello Barbie”
A new high-tech Barbie has sparked a furious outcry from the advocacy group Campaign for a Commercial-Free Childhood. Through a Wi-Fi connection and a built-in microphone
column2: the new Barbie is able to hold conversations with a child. Critics
column3: in addition to the privacy concerns
column4: are worried that Mattel is exploiting the children and using them for financial gain because they can learn the child’s likes and dislikes. Mattel counters that there are safety precautions put in place and that the toy fills a niche for children who want to be able to speak with their Barbie."/['Sean Adl-Tabatabai']/2015-07-19 02:02:45+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/smart-technology-spying.jpg.optimal.jpg"

Magistrate George Lyons said “justice is only going to be […]/[]//"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/exorcism-326x245.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: https://newspunch.com/busted-video-prince-andrew-inside-pedo-jeffrey-epsteins-house-horrors//BUSTED: Video Shows Prince Andrew Inside Pedo Jeffrey Epstein’s ‘House of Horrors’/"Video evidence has emerged showing Prince Andrew inside pedophile billionaire Jeffrey Epstein’s mansion in New York.
The footage
column2: obtained by the Daily Mail
column3: was filmed in 2010 – two years after Epstein was convicted of having sex with a minor and nine years before he was arrested for child sex trafficking.

column1: The footage and pictures show Epstein walking out of the front door of his Manhattan home – which has been dubbed a ‘House of Horrors‘ by many – accompanied by a young blonde girl.
Later that day
column2: the front door opens again and another young woman leaves
column3: and the face of Prince Andrew can be seen as he says goodbye to her. He can be seen seen peering around the side of the door
column4: checking to see if anybody has witnessed him
column5: before promptly closing it.

column1: Dailymail.co.uk reports: The Duke has vehemently denied claims by Epstein’s alleged ‘sex slave’ Virginia Roberts that she had sex with the Prince on three occasions
column2: the first when she was 17 and once at the US millionaire’s now-notorious 40-room mansion at 9 East 71st Street in Manhattan
column3: the setting of these pictures.

column1: Her allegations
column2: submitted to a court in 2014
column3: were later thrown out by a judge who ordered them to be struck from the record as ‘immaterial and impertinent’.

column1: Since Epstein’s suicide last weekend as he faced further child sex trafficking charges
column2: Buckingham Palace has repeated its denial of wrongdoing by the Prince.

column1: ‘Any suggestion of impropriety with underage minors is categorically untrue. It is emphatically denied that the Duke of York had any form of sexual contact or relationship with Virginia Roberts
column2: ’ it said.

column1: ‘Any claim to the contrary is false and without foundation.’
The Queen also made a public show of support by allowing Prince Andrew to sit next to her as they were driven to a church service near Balmoral last Sunday.
However
column2: these images are sure to raise fresh questions about the 59-year-old’s judgment as they place him inside the private
column3: inner sanctum of Epstein
column4: who continued to abuse young girls even after a controversial 2008 plea deal that saw him serve just 13 months
column5: much of it on day release.

column1: ‘The Prince looked entirely at ease in Epstein’s house
column2: ’ a source told The Mail on Sunday last night.

column1: ‘There were girls coming and going. One
column2: who came out of the house with Epstein about an hour before Prince Andrew said goodbye to the brunette
column3: was tiny and shivering.

column1: ‘It was a particularly cold New York December day. What I remember most is the constant procession of girls and women going to and from the house.
‘It was chilling to see. Everyone knew by that point that Epstein was a convicted paedophile
column2: yet he was flaunting his lifestyle in plain sight.

column1: ‘When the Prince came to the door I was stunned. He looked totally at ease. He said a few words to the girl
column2: who was very pretty
column3: and then she walked off down the street in the direction of Central Park.

column1: ‘If I hadn’t known it was Prince Andrew
column2: I would have thought he owned the place. He looked so comfortable and relaxed as he stood there at the door.

column1: ‘He didn’t appear to have a concern in the world as he smiled and waved goodbye to the girl.
‘It was only as the girl walked off that he glanced around the door frame
column2: almost as if to check no one was watching.’

column1: The video was taken less than 24 hours after the Prince was infamously photographed walking through Central Park with Epstein.
He had met the US businessman through Ghislaine Maxwell
column2: the daughter of disgraced tycoon Robert Maxwell and a woman the FBI says is now of ‘renewed interest’ in its ongoing case into allegations made by scores of women that they were sexually abused by Epstein and his wealthy friends at homes in London
column3: New Mexico
column4: New York and the US Virgin Islands.

column1: Ms Maxwell has repeatedly denied that she acted as a ‘madam’ for Epstein and has described Ms Roberts’s claims as ‘malicious lies’.
Epstein’s New York home was as weird and twisted as the man himself. The entry foyer where Prince Andrew stood to wave off the brunette was decorated
column2: according to an account by writer Vicky Ward in Vanity Fair magazine
column3: with ‘row upon row’ of individually framed artificial eyeballs – imported from England.

column1: The video footage shows the initials ‘JE’ in raised brass letters on the wall next to the front door.
What is not seen is the heating element that Epstein had installed beneath the concrete pavement to melt the New York winter snow.
On a wall in the hall was a bizarre portrait of former US President Bill Clinton in red heels and the infamous stained blue dress worn by Monica Lewinsky when she performed a sex act on him.
Nearby hung a giant painting of Epstein inside a prison surrounded by barbed wire and gun-toting guards.
The disgraced financier reportedly said the artwork was ‘to remind me that I could go back to prison any time’.
A chandelier had a ‘life-size female doll hanging from it
column2: and one woman who claims to have been assaulted by Epstein said a bathroom had prosthetic breasts on the wall ‘so he could play with the nipples as he took a bath’.

column1: Dozens of photographs of Epstein with his famous friends
column2: including Bill and Hillary Clinton
column3: Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman and filmmaker Woody Allen
column4: were on display in his study beside a life-size stuffed tiger and a stuffed grey poodle.

column1: One can only wonder how Andrew missed the procession of women or the signs of Epstein’s sexual deviance.
Indeed
column2: Epstein’s ‘pride and joy’ was a large ‘human chessboard’ at the bottom of the main staircase which had customised figurines modelled on his female ‘staff members wearing suggestive clothing’.

column1: Then there was the life-size statue of a naked African warrior. Not to mention the ‘leather room’.
When the FBI raided the house after Epstein was arrested last month
column2: it reportedly found ‘thousands’ of indecent images of under-age women on computer hard drives locked in his office safe.

column1: Others have claimed that Epstein had photographs and videos of his famous friends ‘engaged in sex acts’ which have now been seized by the FBI – prompting conspiracy theories that Epstein was murdered despite official autopsy results released on Friday stating definitively that the cause of death was suicide.

The video obtained by The Mail on Sunday is particularly shocking for the fact that – even two years after his 2008 child sex conviction – Epstein was seemingly flaunting his penchant for young women in plain view and in the middle of one of the busiest cities in the world.
The footage begins just before 2.30pm on December 6
column3: as two security men leave Epstein’s mansion and chat to another security man in a waiting Chrysler.

column1: Epstein’s black Bentley arrives in the street about 20 minutes later
column2: shortly before a delivery man from Le Gourmet delivers a parcel.

column1: Shortly after 3.10pm
column2: an unidentified young woman in a red ‘beanie’ hat leaves the house. She heads in the direction of East 66th Street
column3: where Epstein owned a flat and where
column4: according to some alleged victims
column5: he ‘kept’ young Eastern European girls as virtual prisoners.

column1: About 25 minutes later
column2: an older
column3: professional-looking woman with blonde hair leaves the house.

column1: One minute later
column2: at 3.35pm
column3: Epstein
column4: wearing a thick white fur-lined winter coat
column5: leaves his property
column6: followed by a young-looking girl dressed in a flimsy grey top. She appears to be carrying his glasses.

column1: In a deeply troubling scene
column2: the blonde-haired woman – who barely reaches Epstein’s shoulders – appears cold and shaking as she walks with the millionaire to his Bentley.

column1: Epstein clambers into the back seat as the young woman stands on the street
column2: seemingly being given instructions. An older passer-by glances at the incongruous-looking couple.

column1: After around two minutes
column2: the girl jogs back to the house when she stands on the front step and presses the doorbell
column3: visibly shaking with cold.

column1: It is opened by a professional-looking brunette woman closely resembling Sarah Kellen
column2: Epstein’s former assistant whom several alleged victims have dubbed a ‘co-conspirator’ in Epstein’s crimes.

column1: Kellen
column2: who is now married to a US race-car driver called Brian Vickers
column3: has never commented publicly about the Epstein case.

column1: However
column2: she appeared in court during a defamation suit brought by Ms Roberts against Ms Maxwell and ‘pleaded the Fifth’ when asked about her role in Epstein’s sex trafficking scheme.

column1: In America
column2: invoking the Fifth Amendment is a legal term which means you do not have to give evidence that might incriminate you.

column1: At 4.30pm
column2: the door opens and a pretty brunette emerges. She pauses and turns back to the house where Prince Andrew can be seen at the door.

column1: The pair chat for a few seconds before the woman walks away
column2: leaving Andrew to glance up the street before closing the door.

column1: Forty minutes later
column2: as the light begins to fade
column3: another young-looking dark-haired woman arrives at the house."/['Sean Adl-Tabatabai']/2019-08-19 16:44:54+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/08/prince-andrew-epstein.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: https://newspunch.com/chinese-bullet-trains-whiz-past-each-other-at-840-kmh-setting-record//"Chinese Bullet Trains Whiz Past Each Other At 840 km/h
column2: Setting Record"/"China has set a new world record for trains passing one another at speed.

column1: Two Chinese bullet trains
column2: each travelling at 420 km per hour along parallel tracks in opposite directions
column3: successfully passed within 1.6 meters of each other during a test run in central China on Friday.

column1: RT reports:
Two bullet trains were tested at the same time in an effort to prove the quality of China’s high speed trains.
The test took place in Zhengzhou
column2: central China. The trains
column3: known as Golden Phoenix and Dolphin Blue zipped past each other with only 1.6 meters of space between them.

column1: Watch: China tests high-speed trains with passing speed of 420 kilometers pic.twitter.com/a2Go2Pyues — Press TV (@PressTV) July 15
The trains passing each other at speed was a crucial part of the testing phase
column2: according to one of the officials involved in the project.

column1: “When a train passes another train
column2: its engine will bring a great pressure disturbance to impact the body of the latter
column3: which will affect the fatigue strength of the train body and the pressure in and out of the train
column4: ” said Wang Yueming
column5: chief researcher at China’s Academy of Railway Science.

column1: “This will help us collect data about the air-tightness of the train body and the firmness of the connections of the installed components.”
Footage taken from inside one of the trains captures the extraordinary speed at which the futuristic trains passed each other.
China is home to the longest high-speed railway
column2: but its rail modernization ambitions suffered a major setback following a serious accident five years ago.

40 people were killed and scores injured when two high speed trains collided on a viaduct in the southwest Chinese city of Wenzhou. A government inquiry into the incident found it was caused by a combination of design flaws and project mismanagement.

column1: The fastest operational trains are in Japan
column2: where the Maglev train set a new record in 2015 by hitting speeds of 603 km per hour."/['Edmondo Burr']/2016-07-16 19:15:38+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/07/135516052_14685811811921n-1200x630-cropped.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: https://newspunch.com/4-horsewomen-apocalypse-trump-attack-wack-job-squad//‘4 Horsewomen of The Apocalypse’: Trump Renews Attack on ‘Wack Job’ Squad/"President Donald Trump has tweeted out comments made by a Republican senator who branded the ‘squad’ of four far-left Democratic congresswomen who accused him of racism as “the four horsewomen of the apocalypse.”
In an early-morning Tweetstorm
column2: President Trump posted Louisiana Senator John Kennedy’s comments blasting the women as left-wing “wack jobs” who are “destroying the Democratic Party.”

column1: ….they are destroying the Democrat Party. I’m appalled that so many of our Presidential candidates are falling all over themselves to try to agree with the four horsewomen of the apocalypse. I’m entitled to say that they’re Wack Jobs.” Louisiana Senator John Kennedy — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) July 17
Senator Kennedy claimed the group
column2: which includes socialist New York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Somali Minnesota Rep. Ilhan Omar
column3: think that America “is wicked in its origins” and that Americans are all “racist and evil.”

column1: The Louisiana senator said the women are “entitled to their opinion” but he believes they are “left wing cranks” — stating that they are so stupid they are the sort of people who need to read the “directions on a shampoo bottle” and Americans should ignore them.
“I’m appalled that so many of our Presidential candidates are falling all over themselves to try to agree with the four horsewomen of the apocalypse
column2: ” Kennedy added.

column1: Trump tweeted the comments in apparent agreement with Kennedy amid accusations from the congresswomen that he is “racist.” The four women have fiercely criticized the president over border security policies and a host of other issues
column2: even appearing at times to aggravate some Democratic Party elders with their ferocity
column3: including House Speaker Nancy Pelosi.

column1: In a separate Twitter tirade last weekend
column2: Trump told the members of the so-called ‘squad’ to go back to the “totally broken and crime infested” countries from which they came. Only one of the women
column3: however
column4: was not born in the United States.

column1: House Democrats tabled a resolution on Tuesday condemning Trump for the tweets against the freshman congresswomen
column2: calling his remarks a “blatant racist attack.” Trump said during an event at the White House on Monday that he is not concerned by all the outrage
column3: however
column4: since “many people agree” with him.

column1: He also tweeted on Tuesday denying the allegations of racism
column2: saying that he does not have a “racist bone” in his body."/['Baxter Dmitry']/2019-07-17 19:09:56+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Trump-attacks-dumb-squad.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: https://newspunch.com/police-face-backlash-for-installing-watch-towers-in-london-to-enforce-social-distancing/#comments/Police Face Backlash For Installing ‘Watch Towers’ In London To Enforce Social Distancing/"The police have reportedly installed “watch towers” on London’s Oxford Street to make sure people are adhering to social distancing rules.
Social media users have blasted the move comparing the ‘Orwellian’ police watch towers to something out of a ‘dystopian’ novel.
RT reports: Luke Johnson
column2: a British entrepreneur
column3: shared a picture of the new installations on Friday
column4: raising eyebrows among Brits who questioned whether it was an appropriate way to spend taxpayer money. Many denounced the new street features as a “stupid waste” of resources.

column1: This is the latest lockdown lunacy from govt: police patrol towers on Oxford St pavement – enforcing 2m distancing. Dystopian overreach and waste of taxpayer money. No wonder citizens have no respect for authorities. pic.twitter.com/yMNrsiYABw — Luke Johnson (@LukeJohnsonRCP) June 26
Many also pointed out that the “two-meter rule” is guidance
column2: not an actual law
column3: making the decision to have police monitor citizens’ behavior especially debatable.

column1: Others complained that the watchtowers were something more likely to be seen in an authoritarian state like North Korea.
The towers were also branded as “dystopian” and “Orwellian
column2: ” with one user dubbing them “Covid-1984” towers.

column1: The decision to install the watchpoints comes as London Mayor Sadiq Khan announced £110mn in police cuts
column2: which left one Twitter user wondering how authorities still had “enough money to turn London into a concentration camp.”"/['Niamh Harris']/2020-06-27 14:59:26+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Covid-1984-watch-police-towers-1200x630-cropped.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: https://newspunch.com/kentucky-firefighter-dies-after-ice-bucket-challenge-accident//Kentucky firefighter dies after ice bucket challenge accident/"From Yahoo!News (source link): “A Kentucky firefighter who was severely injured a month ago while helping college students take part in an “ice-bucket” fundraiser died on Saturday from his injuries
column2: authorities said.

column1: Captain Tony Grider
column3: of Campbellsville was hurt along with three other firefighters when an aerial ladder got too close to a power line as their department doused a university band with water.

column1: Kyle Smith
column2: the chief of Campbellsville Fire and Rescue
column3: said Grider died at noon at University of Louisville hospital.

column1: “His family would like to sincerely thank all of those who have been there for them following this tragic accident
column2: ” Smith said in a statement.

column1: Grider and his three colleagues were injured on Aug. 21 when they were attempting to help students at Campbellsville University participate in the ice bucket challenge to raise funds to fight amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
column2: also known as Lou Gehrig’s disease.

column1: Grider and another firefighter
column2: 22-year-old Simon Quinn
column3: sustained electrocution injuries in the initial incident. Two other firefighters suffered lesser injuries coming to their aid
column4: officials said.

column1: Quinn was released from hospital earlier this week.
“These injuries were very severe and both firefighters have fought extremely hard to overcome them
column2: ” Smith said.

column1: Arrangements for Grider’s funeral service were still pending.”"/['Royce Christyn']/2014-09-22 00:51:47+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/firefighter-dies-ice-bucket-challenge-jpg.jpg.optimal.jpg"

https://newspunch.com/report-says-uk-nukes-can-be-hacked-by-cyber-terrorists//Report Says UK Nukes Can Be ‘Hacked’ By Cyber Terrorists/"An embarrassing new report has highlighted the poor security of Britain’s nuclear weapons. The study
column2: commissioned by the European Leadership Network (ELN)
column3: highlights the fact that UK nukes could be hacked by cyber terrorists
column4: allowing them to launch a missile from a submarine.

column1: The study worryingly concludes that Britain’s nuclear weapons can never be fully protected against a cyber attack.
Presstv.ir reports:
According to the report
column2: there is evidence hackers have sought to compromise radio communications used to send launch approval messages
column3: in an attempt to attack the nuclear submarines.

column1: “By far the biggest fear and worst-case scenario is that hackers somehow compromise or sabotage the submarine or the weapons it carries
column2: ” Andrew Futter
column3: senior lecturer in international politics at the University of Leicester wrote in an article for the ELN.

column1: “UK submarines receive regular radio transmissions from ashore that could theoretically be attacked
column2: such as weather updates needed for targeting and the regular FamilyGram…This will almost certainly involve malware introduced during the procurement phase while the submarine/missiles/warheads are being built
column3: or when the submarine is in port for maintenance
column4: refurbishment and software updates
column5: ” Dr Futter added.

column1: “Given that the UK is likely on the cusp of building the next generation of nuclear-armed submarines
column2: this challenge
column3: and guarding against threats to the supply chain and overall maintenance
column4: is particularly relevant now
column5: ” he reiterated.

column1: Earlier in January
column2: leader of UK Labour Party Jeremy Corbyn called for nuclear “de-escalation” in the UK
column3: saying nukes should not be carried on submarines.

column1: Corbyn said the UK could keep its controversial Trident submarine fleet but without carrying nuclear warheads.
The opposition leader is at odds with many of his MPs over the future of the UK nuclear weapons system.
Back in October
column2: a report showed the overall costs for Britain to replace and maintain its controversial nuclear deterrent program could stand at around £167 billion ($256 billion) – a figure the critics say is far more than expected.

column1: The Trident program was announced in July 1980. Since 1998
column2: it has been the only British nuclear weapon system in service. Its stated purpose is to provide “the minimum effective nuclear deterrent as the ultimate means to deter the most extreme threat.”

column1: Those opposed to the renewal of Trident say that the changing threats of global terrorism and climate change means that Britain does not need a hugely costly renewal of nuclear deterrents."/['Sean Adl-Tabatabai']/2016-02-06 23:45:37+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/UK-Nuclear-weapons-cyber-attack-1200x630-cropped.jpg.optimal.jpg"

https://newspunch.com/brussels-100-billion-bill-eu-army//Brussels Slaps UK With €100 Billion Bill For EU Army/"Brussels has slapped the UK government with a staggering €100 billion bill in order to help them fund their EU army.
The European Union is demanding that member states
column2: including the UK
column3: spend over £86 billion
column4: despite the fact that the UK has formerly chosen to leave the EU.

column1: According to a report
column2: “EU citizens expect more EU action in defence and security.” The report states that the EU intends to increase its national defence expenditure to two per cent of EU GDP – which equates to 100 billion euros by the end of the next decade.

column1: Express.co.uk reports:
The EU is determined to make Britain pay for The Common Security and Defence Policy (CSDP) as negotiations get set to begin on Brexit
column2: in which Brussels chiefs have warned Theresa May to expect a £50billion exit bill.

column1: The defence report says that there is “need for deeper discussions on the future relation between the Union and the United Kingdom in CSDP matters
column2: and in particular in the field of military capabilities
column3: should the UK decide to trigger Article 50 TEU”.

column1: Despite the huge spending demands
column2: the EU admits at least one project in landlocked Mali in Africa is failing after three years due to lack of powers.

column1: The report states: “European soldiers are currently prohibited from taking part in military operations as observers
column2: which means that they cannot identify any problems that the units that have been trained may have
column3: and that they are therefore unable to resolve any operational problems at a later stage.

column1: “These units – both in Mali and in the Central African Republic – are being set up for combat operations
column2: and whereas after three years without appropriate equipment and training
column3: as is the case for EUTM Mali
column4: they are nowhere near operational.

column1: “Without the necessary armaments
column2: training missions will only be carried out abroad if the government of the country concerned provides armaments and hardware to the units that they can then continue to use after their training is complete.”

column1: Ukip defence spokesman Bill Etheridge hit out at the plans and said: “Since the declaration of St Malo was signed in 1998 to advance the creation of a Common Securirty and Defence policy an EU Army has been happening – regardless of what you call it.
“Former Commission President Romano Prodi called for an EU Army in 1999
column2: saying it was ‘inevitable’. In the face of all these semantics
column3: perhaps he put it best when he said: ‘When I was talking about a European Army
column4: I was not joking.

column1: “’If you do not want to call it a European Army
column2: do not call it a European Army.

column1: “’You can call it ‘Margaret’
column2: you can call it ‘Mary-Anne’
column3: you can find any name
column4: but it is a joint effort for peace-keeping missions – the first time you have a joint
column5: not bilateral
column6: effort at European level.’

column1: “The Lisbon Treaty we signed up to put this on the statue books.
“It is happening and pretending it isn’t or that we haven’t contributed financially or diplomatically won’t change that.
“The UK taxpayer must not pay one penny piece into funding EU battlegroups: the priority for us is to build up our own weakened military and reverse the chronic underfunding of previous governments.”
Mr Etheridge added the Government “must rule out any money from the UK being spent on an EU military
column2: particularly when we have a recruitment and retention crisis in the UK Armed Forces and they are so short of cash they are even trying to cancel secure communications from loved ones to those serving abroad”.

column1: The MEP said the UK “must have no operational role in any EU battlegroups and instead concentrate on meeting our NATO commitments”.
He added: ”Unlike the EU
column2: which admits it has spent three years in Mali achieving nothing
column3: NATO has bite.”

column1: Mr Etheridge called on the Secretary of State for Defence to rule out any funding post Brexit and said there must be no “back door routes keeping us tied into any EU military projects”.
He added: “The British people voted against an EU military
column2: despite being spun lies that it was not happening – they knew it was and they are vehemently opposed to it.”

column1: The EU report further adds it is planning to remove an almost obsolete operation from Britain which was rolled out in 2008.
The project called Operation Atalanta is an initiative that was set up to tackle Somali pirates.
After Brexit the EU wants it removed from Britain stating: “New command arrangements need to be found with regard to the Northwood Operational Headquarters for Operation Atalanta.”
But the operation’s website reveals there are no current active situations
column2: there have been no pirate disruptions for three years and that there are no hostages.

column1: And the “countering piracy” initiative uses space in London to coordinate its strategy taking attention away from British naval matters.
Mr Etheridge said: ”MEPs probably think they are playing hardball taking the Operational HQ for Atalanta out of Northwood but it’s a win for us and a lose for them.
“They have used our top class secure facilities probably without paying us any money for them and now we won’t have that burden.
“But the EU Navy’s own figures on Somali pirates tell the story: no vessels held by pirates
column2: no hostages held and no operations against Somali pirates in 2017 so far.

column1: “Far from a serious fighting force

column1: https://newspunch.com/brussels-100-billion-bill-eu-army/#respond/Brussels Slaps UK With €100 Billion Bill For EU Army/"Brussels has slapped the UK government with a staggering €100 billion bill in order to help them fund their EU army.
The European Union is demanding that member states
column2: including the UK
column3: spend over £86 billion
column4: despite the fact that the UK has formerly chosen to leave the EU.

column1: According to a report
column2: “EU citizens expect more EU action in defence and security.” The report states that the EU intends to increase its national defence expenditure to two per cent of EU GDP – which equates to 100 billion euros by the end of the next decade.

column1: Express.co.uk reports:
The EU is determined to make Britain pay for The Common Security and Defence Policy (CSDP) as negotiations get set to begin on Brexit
column2: in which Brussels chiefs have warned Theresa May to expect a £50billion exit bill.

column1: The defence report says that there is “need for deeper discussions on the future relation between the Union and the United Kingdom in CSDP matters
column2: and in particular in the field of military capabilities
column3: should the UK decide to trigger Article 50 TEU”.

column1: Despite the huge spending demands
column2: the EU admits at least one project in landlocked Mali in Africa is failing after three years due to lack of powers.

column1: The report states: “European soldiers are currently prohibited from taking part in military operations as observers
column2: which means that they cannot identify any problems that the units that have been trained may have
column3: and that they are therefore unable to resolve any operational problems at a later stage.

column1: “These units – both in Mali and in the Central African Republic – are being set up for combat operations
column2: and whereas after three years without appropriate equipment and training
column3: as is the case for EUTM Mali
column4: they are nowhere near operational.

column1: “Without the necessary armaments
column2: training missions will only be carried out abroad if the government of the country concerned provides armaments and hardware to the units that they can then continue to use after their training is complete.”

column1: Ukip defence spokesman Bill Etheridge hit out at the plans and said: “Since the declaration of St Malo was signed in 1998 to advance the creation of a Common Securirty and Defence policy an EU Army has been happening – regardless of what you call it.
“Former Commission President Romano Prodi called for an EU Army in 1999
column2: saying it was ‘inevitable’. In the face of all these semantics
column3: perhaps he put it best when he said: ‘When I was talking about a European Army
column4: I was not joking.

column1: “’If you do not want to call it a European Army
column2: do not call it a European Army.

column1: “’You can call it ‘Margaret’
column2: you can call it ‘Mary-Anne’
column3: you can find any name
column4: but it is a joint effort for peace-keeping missions – the first time you have a joint
column5: not bilateral
column6: effort at European level.’

column1: “The Lisbon Treaty we signed up to put this on the statue books.
“It is happening and pretending it isn’t or that we haven’t contributed financially or diplomatically won’t change that.
“The UK taxpayer must not pay one penny piece into funding EU battlegroups: the priority for us is to build up our own weakened military and reverse the chronic underfunding of previous governments.”
Mr Etheridge added the Government “must rule out any money from the UK being spent on an EU military
column2: particularly when we have a recruitment and retention crisis in the UK Armed Forces and they are so short of cash they are even trying to cancel secure communications from loved ones to those serving abroad”.

column1: The MEP said the UK “must have no operational role in any EU battlegroups and instead concentrate on meeting our NATO commitments”.
He added: ”Unlike the EU
column2: which admits it has spent three years in Mali achieving nothing
column3: NATO has bite.”

column1: Mr Etheridge called on the Secretary of State for Defence to rule out any funding post Brexit and said there must be no “back door routes keeping us tied into any EU military projects”.
He added: “The British people voted against an EU military
column2: despite being spun lies that it was not happening – they knew it was and they are vehemently opposed to it.”

column1: The EU report further adds it is planning to remove an almost obsolete operation from Britain which was rolled out in 2008.
The project called Operation Atalanta is an initiative that was set up to tackle Somali pirates.
After Brexit the EU wants it removed from Britain stating: “New command arrangements need to be found with regard to the Northwood Operational Headquarters for Operation Atalanta.”
But the operation’s website reveals there are no current active situations
column2: there have been no pirate disruptions for three years and that there are no hostages.

column1: And the “countering piracy” initiative uses space in London to coordinate its strategy taking attention away from British naval matters.
Mr Etheridge said: ”MEPs probably think they are playing hardball taking the Operational HQ for Atalanta out of Northwood but it’s a win for us and a lose for them.
“They have used our top class secure facilities probably without paying us any money for them and now we won’t have that burden.
“But the EU Navy’s own figures on Somali pirates tell the story: no vessels held by pirates
column2: no hostages held and no operations against Somali pirates in 2017 so far.

column1: “Far from a serious fighting force
column2: this is more of a red herring: quite frankly you see more pirates captured in an episode of Poldark.”"/['Sean Adl-Tabatabai']/2017-03-26 19:38:55+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/EU-army-bill-UK.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: https://newspunch.com/donald-trump-will-look-into-911-iraq-war-when-president//"Donald Trump Will Look Into 9/11 & Iraq War When President"/"Last night during an interview on CNN with Anderson Cooper
column2: the Republican front-runner Donald Trump said that former president George W. Bush lied about WMD’s in Iraq and initiated the Iraq war under false pretenses.

column1: If Donald Trump occupies the White House he says he will look into the events of 9/11 and why the Bush administration started the Iraq War to get rid of Saddam Hussein.
The decision to go to war in Iraq was the worst decision ever made in history
column2: according to Donald Trump. The Donald wants to know why some Saudis were allowed to leave the country and go back to Saudi Arabia following the 9/11 attacks of 11 September 2001.

column1: He believes that the hijackers were Saudis but does not understand why the George W. Bush administration went on to attack Iraq and its leader Saddam Hussein.
Sealed documents containing classified information would be looked at by a future Trump administration
column2: and the past which led to all the present problems in the world will be investigated
column3: according to the Republican front-runner and straight-talker.

column1: Terrorism in the Middle East has not only become a danger to America
column2: that now requires immediate attention and action
column3: but is threatening to spread into Asia
column4: Russia
column5: Africa
column6: and the Far East
column7: with the ensuing chaos leading to a possible global confrontation between the super powers.

column1: Meanwhile the so called Islamic State/ISIS ideology spreads and threatens the world like a cancer
column2: mainly thanks to the extreme interpretation of Islam promoted by the so called Saudi 9/11 hijackers
column3: the Al-Qaeda precursors to ISIS.

https://newspunch.com/russia-warns-us-against-deploying-wmds-in-space//Russia Warns US Against Deploying WMDs In Space/"A Russian Senator has warned that Moscow is ready to “strongly retaliate” if the US violates the outer space treaty by putting weapons of mass destruction into orbit.
He added that Washington’s plan to create a Space Force could lead to catastrophe
The militarization of space is a way to disaster
column2: ” Viktor Bondarev
column3: the head of the Russian Federation Council’s Defense and Security Committee told RIA news agency the day after the US President Donald Trump ordered the creation of a new branch of the US military tasked with operating in what he called “forbidden skies.”

column1: RT reports: The senator warned that Washington could potentially violate international agreements regulating the demilitarization of space and thus put the international security in a grave danger. “There is a major risk that the Americans would commit grave violations in this field … if one takes into account what they do in other spheres
column2: ” Bondarev said.

column1: “If the US withdraws from the 1967 agreement that bans deployment of nuclear weapons in space
column2: [such a move] will be followed by a tough response not only from our state but from other states as well
column3: which would be aimed at preserving international security
column4: ” he added.

column1: The 1967 Outer Space Treaty
column2: to which the US is a party
column3: prohibits deployment of nuclear weapons as well as any other weapons of mass destruction (WMDs) in the Earth’s orbit. It also bans states from testing any weapons in outer space
column4: or establishing military bases on the Moon and other celestial bodies.

column1: Trump’s Monday speech notably mentioned a push to establish a “permanent presence” on the Moon
column2: with an eye to a manned Mars mission
column3: although he did not say if military would be involved. The US leader
column4: however
column5: called for establishing “dominance” in space
column6: calling it a matter of national security.

column1: The US has a history of unilaterally withdrawing from international treaties that regulate military activities. Back in 2002
column2: US President George W. Bush withdrew from the Anti-Ballistic Missile Treaty (ABM) Treaty
column3: which had been one of the main pillars of the détente and held for nearly 30 years.

column1: Moscow and Washington have also traded accusations of violating the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces (INF) Treaty. The Russian President Vladimir Putin accused the US of de-facto leaving the INF
column2: saying that missiles from the US ballistic defense system deployed in Romania can be easily converted to middle-range projectiles to target Russia."/['Niamh Harris']/2018-06-19 18:50:17+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/WMDs-1200x630-cropped.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: https://newspunch.com/study-irish-dna-originated-in-middle-east-eastern-europe//Study: Irish DNA Originated In Middle East & Eastern Europe/"Scientists have discovered that Irish DNA originated in the Middle East and Eastern Europe.
The DNA of ancient occupants of Ireland has given researchers a breakthrough clue into the history of the Celtic population.
The study was led by Queens University Belfast and Trinity College Dublin where scientists sequenced the first ancient human genomes from Ireland
column2: shedding light on the genesis of Celtic populations.

column1: Details of the work
column2: by geneticists from Trinity College Dublin and archaeologists from Queen’s University Belfast are published in the journal PNAS.

column1: The Guardian reports:
Scientists from Dublin and Belfast have looked deep into Ireland’s early history to discover a still-familiar pattern of migration: of stone age settlers with origins in the Fertile Crescent
column2: and bronze age economic migrants who began a journey somewhere in eastern Europe.

column1: The evidence has lain for more than 5
column2: 000 years in the bones of a woman farmer unearthed from a tomb in Ballynahatty
column3: near Belfast
column4: and in the remains of three men who lived between 3
column5: 000 and 4
column6: 000 years ago and were buried on Rathlin Island in County Antrim.

column1: Scientists at Trinity College Dublin used a technique called whole-genome analysis to “read” not the unique characteristics of each individual
column2: but a wider history of ancestral migration and settlement in the DNA from all four bodies.

column1: They confirm a picture that has been emerging for decades from archaeological studies. Migrant communities did not compete with the original Irish. They became the Irish.
The ancestors of the Stone Age farmers began their journey in the Bible lands
column2: where agriculture first began
column3: and arrived in Ireland perhaps via the southern Mediterranean. They brought with them cattle
column4: cereals
column5: ceramics and a tendency to black hair and brown eyes.

column1: These settlers were followed by people
column2: initially from the Pontic steppe of southern Russia
column3: who knew how to mine for copper and work with gold
column4: and who carried the genetic variant for a blood disorder called haemochromatosis
column5: a hereditary genetic condition so common in Ireland that it is sometimes called Celtic disease.

column1: These people also brought with them the inherited variation that permits the digestion of milk in maturity – much of the world becomes intolerant to the milk sugar lactose after infancy – and they may even have brought the language that became what is now Irish. Some of them
column2: too
column3: had blue eyes.

column1: “There was a great wave of genome change that swept into Europe from above the Black Sea into Bronze Age Europe and we now know it washed all the way to the shores of its most westerly island
column2: ” said Dan Bradley
column3: professor of population genetics at Trinity College Dublin.

column1: “And this degree of genetic change invites the possibility of other associated changes
column2: perhaps even the introduction of language ancestral to western Celtic tongues.”

column1: The Dublin team and colleagues from Queens University Belfast report in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences that the two great changes in European prehistory – the emergence of agriculture and the advance of metallurgy – were not just culture shifts: they came with new blood. An earlier population of hunter gatherers was successively overwhelmed by new arrivals. And in Ireland
column2: these new settlers began to define a nation.

column1: “These findings
column2: ” the authors say
column3: “suggest the establishment of central attributes of the Irish genome 4
column4: 000 years ago.”

column1: Working from the principle that any human DNA tells a story not just of individual identity but of ten thousand years of ancestry
column2: researchers have begun to piece together the entire story of Homo sapiens. The story is incomplete
column3: and under constant revision
column4: but the outline of the settlement of Europe and Asia told by DNA confirms and illuminates the archaeological evidence."/['Niamh Harris']/2015-12-29 17:36:53+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/12/skull.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: https://newspunch.com/iraqi-citizens-to-sue-us-government-for-war-crimes//Iraqi Citizens To Sue US Government For War Crimes/"The White House has expressed concern over proposals to allow Iraqi citizens to sue the U.S. government for war crimes committed during the Iraq war.
As Congress try to override Obama’s recent veto of legislation that would have allowed US citizens to sue Saudi Arabia over its role in orchestrating the Sept. 11 attacks
column2: an organization representing Iraqi victims is threatening to sue and hold the American government accountable for its war crimes.

column1: Sputniknews.com reports:
The Iraqi National Project has stated that the Justice Against Sponsors of Terrorism Act
column2: which would allow 9/11 victims and families to sue Saudi Arabia over the nation’s role in the attacks
column3: has opened a pathway for lawsuits against foreign governments.

column1: The White House claims that the bill was vetoed because it would open the floodgates for other nations and organizations to sue the US
column2: which is exactly what the Iraqi group wants to do.

column1: “In light of the majority vote by the US Congress and Senate in support of the 9/11 bill removing the sovereign immunity rights of Saudi Arabia and other countries accused of being implicated in terrorism—and in spite of President Obama’s veto on September 23rd 2016—we hereby declare that if this bill is actually passed and becomes a law
column2: then it constitutes a window of opportunity for millions of Iraqis who have lost their sons and daughters in military operations by US military forces and US contracted forces since the US invasion in 2003 to pursue compensation from the US government for what they have endured
column3: ” a letter published by the Iraqi National Project states
column4: according to the Washington Free Beacon.

column1: They cited US bombings of civilians and the well-documented torture that took place in Abu Ghraib.
“These US operations included bombings of civilians
column2: arrests
column3: torture [like in Abu Ghraib prison]
column4: and in numerous camps set up by the US forces across Iraq
column5: ” the letter continues. “There are also tens of thousands of maimed and handicapped Iraqis as a result of this injustice.” The group also asserts that all of those horrors were based on faulty US intelligence.

column1: “The majority of the injustices were based on very sketchy information and very discriminatory methods with numerous omissions from US officials and ex-officials
column2: ” the letter reads. “Once the 9/11 bill becomes law
column3: we will endeavor and assist on a strong effort towards the formation of special committees seated by top Iraqi lawyers and judges along with numerous international legal advisers.”

column1: The Saudi government has repeatedly denied any involvement in the 2001 attacks which left nearly 3
column2: 000 people dead
column3: but many have long suspected that the hijackers of four planes that crashed into targets in New York
column4: Washington DC and rural Pennsylvania were backed by Riyadh.

column1: The bill
column2: which may become subject to the first presidential veto override during Obama’s term in office
column3: has left many lawmakers in a tough spot
column4: as they want to see justice for the victims of terror attacks
column5: but are concerned with the precedent it sets.

column1: “I worry about legal matters. I worry about trial lawyers trying to get rich off of this. And I do worry about the precedence. At the same time
column2: these victims do need to have their day in court
column3: ” House Speaker Paul Ryan told reporters.

column1: A veto override requires two thirds of lawmakers to vote in favor of it
column2: in both the Senate and House of Representatives.

column1: Even key Democrats have said they will stand by the bill
column2: despite the president’s objections
column3: including Nancy Pelosi.

column1: “I’ve worked with these families for a very long time
column2: and I think they should have their day in court
column3: ” House Democratic Leader Nancy Pelosi told reporters last week."/['Sean Adl-Tabatabai']/2016-09-28 05:58:15+00:00/"https://cdn.newspunch.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Iraqis-sue-US-government-war-crimes.jpg.optimal.jpg"

column1: The bill
column2: which may become subject to the first presidential veto override during Obama’s term in office

column4: as they want to see justice for the victims of terror attacks
